title: Fort Union National Monument: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger          EXPLORE. LEARN. PROTECT. Become a Junior Ranger!   Junior Ranger booklets (pdf 1.73MB) are available both at the Visitor Center and online. Filled with fun activities, these books reveal the wonders of Fort Union to kids and parents alike. By completing the exercises, participants earn a Junior Ranger badge and a signed certificate. Activities are designed for ages 6 to 12.        2011 Junior Ranger Camp award ceremony Fort Union National Monument  2015 Junior Ranger Camps Fort Union National Monument will host two all-day Junior Ranger Camps beginning Thursday July 9, thru Friday, July 10, 2015 from 10:00am and ending at 4:00pm. Geared for children ages 7-12, the camps will introduce youngsters to the diverse natural and cultural resources of Fort Union with hands-on games, activities, and ranger-led programs. The July 9th Junior Ranger Camp is geared for children ages 7-9, the July 10th camp for children ages 10-12. ALL CAMPS ARE FREE!!!! Enrollment Begins JUNE 1st, 2015. There is a maximum of 30 children per camp, so please hurry to register your child. Please call the registration phone number at 505-425-8025 between the hours of 8am to 4pm daily. Each Junior Ranger Camp begins at 9:30 AM and ends at 4:00 PM. Junior Ranger Campers should wear comfortable clothes, closed-toe shoes, a hat, bring sunscreen, a bag lunch not needing refrigeration, and a water bottle.       2011 Junior Ranger Camp adobe preservation activity. Fort Union National Monument
